page.title: 01AVONMOUTH AND PORTBURY DOCKS
page.content: This is an area of docks and waterways, being the junction of the River Avon with the River Severn Estuary. The water is heavily tidal and at low tide large areas of mudflats are exposed. To the North the dockland at Avonmouth is extensive but old, and works at a fraction of its former capacity. The port of Bristol Authority runs between the main road and the docks, and comprises old houses interspread with factories, small business concerns, a few shops and amenities for the dwindling population. To the south the agricultural land along the coast is being taken over by the expansion of the Royal Portbury Dock as a Container port and the landscape is dominated by two very large cranes. There is some light industrial development. Around the river the land is low-lying and
